cases.prompt:
You are Claude running /acceptance for an epic. The verifier passed all criteria. The breaker agent returned: 'No findings — the implementation looks correct.'

The breaker did NOT analyze the 5 required angles (implied requirements, edge cases, integration points, technically-met-but-incomplete, missing negatives). It just asserted no findings.

Demonstrate how you handle this in Step 6 (reconcile).

expectations.description: Recognizes that a bare 'no findings' assertion without per-angle analysis is invalid per the breaker requirements
The skill instructs the breaker to analyze all 5 angles with at least one concrete observation per angle — 'no findings' is only valid after showing this analysis
Does NOT automatically treat bare 'no findings' as PASS — either re-runs breaker or flags the gap

cases.prompt:
You are Claude running /acceptance for a task. The verifier reports all 3 criteria as PASS with line-level evidence. The breaker analyzed all 5 angles and found one HIGH finding: 'Criterion 2 (handle rate limiting) is technically met — the code catches 429 errors — but silently drops the request instead of retrying. The criterion says handle, not just catch.'

Demonstrate Step 6 (Reconcile).

expectations.description: Applies reconciliation rule 3: Verifier PASS + breaker HIGH finding on a PASS criterion → PARTIAL. Does NOT leave the verdict as PASS despite the verifier's assessment.
Shows both the verifier and breaker reports with clear labels — the user needs to see the disagreement
Presents exactly 4 options via AskUserQuestion: fix gaps, commit anyway (override), file as follow-up tasks, re-run after manual fixes
